summary: Simon discusses pausing and/or resetting Hytale's Lore, Steam release, & combat screenshot.
mainText:
In a surprise post on Twitter, Simon shared that the entirety of Hytale's lore is reset and/or on hold for review, with the 'Cursebreaker' arc allowing the team to reset the lore and have a starting point. Simon went on to explain that 'resetting' doesn't mean 'deleting,' and instead means a complete review of the lore must be done. Simon further clarified that the general lore of Hytale will stay the same, but there are multiple 'very different' lore paths, and they don't want lore to block the creation of a good game.

Simon confirmed that Gaia and Varyn are still parts of the lore, with Gaia being important 'even in early access.'

When a user pointed out that Hytale's lore is what drew many people to the game, Simon pointed out that theorized lore is not the same as actual lore.

While discussing a Steam release, Simon pointed out that some of Hytale's planned features aren't yet possible on Steam, specifically the Steam Workshop.

The Hytale account on Twitter also shared a new PvE Combat screenshot, with Simon saying a lot has/is improving since his video.

3: Simon - General Lore staying the same

7: Simon - Planned Features not possible on Steam

summary: The Hytale Team shares it's first FAQ blogpost!
mainText:
In a surprise move, the Hytale Team dropped a surprise blogpost covering some of the game's frequently asked questions. The blog, written by Hytale's Executive Director Patrick 'Lyall' Derbic, confirmed that Hytale will not be on Steam (at least initially), and the only confirmed early access versions of Hytale will be for PC (with Mac & Linux still TBD). A console release is planned for a later stage, and the team states they are still evaluating if a mobile version is feasible.

The blog post also addresses the different editions of Hytale, teasing an upcoming reveal for what each edition contains, and confirming players can choose to upgrade between each version even after purchase. The Hytale Team also confirms that there will be no bonuses for pre-purchasing Hytale, to avoid creating FOMO, and that gifting is still being worked on.

Addressing gameplay questions, the blog post confirms pets, animal taming, and fishing systems are planned, but are not currently implemented into the game.

Shifting focus to Hytale's monetization, the team reconfirmed that Hytale will take a 0% cut from third-party server or modding transactions for the first two years, and confirmed a hard cap of a 20% cut after that two year period has lapsed. In a Tweet, Simon promised the Hytale Team would provide players, assets, and/or code if/when they take a % of transactions. On the subject of Hytale's Creator Program, the team announces that anyone that creates Hytale content regularly - videos, music, mods, art, streams, etc - can sign up for the program and (if their code is used) receive 5% from any sales, with plans to raise that percentage to 7%. Simon later revealed that the team is hoping to open the Creator Program before pre-orders.

The blog post also discussed regional pricing, confirming that the team is working to get it functional for a limited number of countries to start with - with the hope being to get it done in time for the pre-purchase. On Twitter, Lyall said regional pricing is his main focus, other than legal work.

summary: The Hytale Team discuss Linux, chunks, and Discord surprises.
mainText:
Discussing Hytale's supported platforms, Slikey stated that the team is using libraries that exist on 'pretty much every platform,' with only past debt left to solve. He also acknowledged potentially using WINE for Linux support, but stated the current plan is to support Linux natively.

When discussing Hytale's chunk system, Slikey confirmed the rumored 32x32x32 figure, noting that Hytale does currently load the entire world top to bottom regardless of the 'cubic chunks' - something he said will eventually be changed.

Simon also teases 'many surprises' for Hytale's Discord community.

summary: The Hytale Team discuss Hytale's main menu, pet mechanics, and preorder benefits.
mainText:
Talking on Twitter, Simon shared screenshots of Hytale's main menu that showed two different scenes, which he says is determined by RNG. Additionally, Simon also shared a screenshot of Hytale's 'worlds' menu, where players can create or edit their worlds. Importantly, Simon said all of Hytale's menus and UI will be reworked post-launch.

Simon also shared that while Hytale doesn't yet have in-depth pet mechanics, it will eventually.

Simon also confirmed pre-order benefits will be shared this week.

summary: The Hytale Team share the Hardware Requirements blogpost, discuss Mac/Linux support.
mainText:
Starting December strong, the Hytale Team shared an in-depth blogpost that revealed the minimum and recommended hardware specifications, along with recommended hardware for content creators. The blogpost also revealed that chunk sizes are 32x32, and that the game is designed around a 384 block view distance, with Slikey clarifying that while a view distance of 768 blocks is Hytale's 'safe limit,' it can be pushed to 1024.

In a separate post on Twitter, Slikey discussed Mac and Linux support, explaining that they're nearly able to fully compile Hytale on Mac & Linux, but only then can testing for those systems start. In his post, Slikey says - barring roadblocks in the testing stage - Hytale might be able to launch with support for Mac & Linux.

summary: The Hytale Team talks Gliders, Scaraks, and World Gen v2.
mainText:
Starting the day off strong, The Hytale Team shared official in-dev gameplay of gliders, with Simon sharing that momentum, wind effects/sounds, animations, and more updates will be made in Early Access. Simon also confirmed that the redesigned Scaraks will eventually be implemented into the game, separate from the originals.

On the technical side of Hytale, Slikey announced that Hytale's Hardware Requirements would be shared on Monday, at 1 PM EST, and also confirmed Hytale does support ultrawide monitors. Discussing the node graph with world generation result on the modding blog post, Slikey confirmed it was real and functional, and even though it was still a prototype, it would be fully usable on day one.

In a standalone Twitter post, Simon teased Hytale's World Gen v2, boldly stating that the new World Gen would redefine the block game genre, and promised a dedicated blog post 'coming soon,' most likely in early/mid December. Simon went on to state that the new world gen is separate from v1, and will be slowly introduced before a 'big entrance' later on, with more and more content using it after early access launch. In a reply to Myne, Simon stated the big difference between v2 and Minecraft world gen mods is that artists can learn to use world gen v2.

9: Simon - v1 and v2 are separate

10: Simon - Content using v2 after launch

summary: The Hytale Team talks redesigned Kweebecs, gliders, and tech.
mainText:
On another slow news day, Simon confirmed the New Kweebecs - the redesigned version created under Riot - will also be in Hytale, though they will come later as they require some animation work. Simon also teased glider gameplay, saying the model and animations aren't currently implemented at the time.

Slikey also said hardware requirements would be shared soon, and a server owner/game server provider manual would be shared at a later point.

summary: The Hytale Team talks performance, and Reddoons shares an exclusive clip.
mainText:
When asked questions about Hytale's client and server performance, Slikey confirmed that the analysis was almost finished, and details would be shared soon.

Reddoons also shared an exclusive gameplay clip, which featured Kweebecs being shot with a pistol while inside one of their village.

summary: The Hytale Team announces Early Access launch, pre-order dates.
mainText: Following Simon's announcement from the day prior, The Hytale Team announced that the game would launch it's early access on January 13th, 2026, with pre-orders launching a month prior, on December 13th, 2025.

summary: Simon shares screenshot for Thanksgiving, talks Hytale's underground.
mainText:
With the Hytale Team on break for Thanksgiving, Simon shared a screenshot of an autumnal biome in Hytale, featuring a turkey.

Simon also discussed Hytale's underground, which he says has crypts, abandoned mines, natural caves, and more. Simon says players donâ€™t need to 'dig straight down,' and instead can just walk around and find an interesting place to start your journey down. Simon promises this will improve with World Gen v2.

summary: The Hytale Team talks food, crafting, seasons, and more.
mainText:
On what is now considered a relatively 'slow' news day, Simon discussed Hytale's food system - acknowledging that it's difficult to make food engaging in a game - and revealed that the team will explore mixing ingredients for food that gives unique buffs, using activity-based meals (ex: mining stew for faster swings), combat meals, feeding NPC villages, getting a quality system tied into bonuses, and/or building food mastery. At the moment, however, Simon says there's not much fun in cooking in Hytale. When asked about the usefulness of potions with the current food system, Simon explained that they can be used for instant/short duration effects for emergencies. Simon also revealed that the world is warmer in the south, and colder in the north - though it doesn't affect farming, for now.

When asked about crafting and chests, Simon revealed that chests have different sizes, and said crafting stations interacting with chests in close proximity was added just a few weeks ago.

Simon also announced that Hytale's Release Date would be revealed on Friday, at 10AM EST. Setting community expectations, Simon confirmed that Hytale wouldn't release before the Holidays, due to the acquisition taking 'just long enough.'

1: Simon - Difficult to make food engaging

summary: The Hytale Team discusses gameplay systems, zones, Creative Mode blog.
mainText:
Simon started the day by stating that trap fishing might be able to be added to compensate for not currently having proper fishing. Answering a user's query about seasonal content, Simon confirmed he had personally made a new crafting bench with all seasonal content just two days prior. When asked about cooking systems, Simon said there previously wasn't a cooking system, and a 'v1' is being worked on. Simon would later release a statement, confirming the WIP assembly of a dedicated team for 'cozy' content, such as building cute homes, caring for animals, and cooking.

Discussing zones, Simon confirmed players can currently only spawn in Zone 1, with Zones 2 and 3 being much more dangerous, adding that new world gen does a much better job at balancing the spawns. Alleviating a user's concerns, Simon confirmed that all zones are accessible, but crafting does slow down in order to prevent skipping to late zones. Simon also stated that the goal is to keep all zones relevant throughout the whole game, in order to give players a true exploration experience.

When asked about Zones 5 and 6, Simon sadly confirmed that they don't exist at the moment - though they might revisit the zones in the future, with new world gen.

The Hytale Team also shared a new blogpost, dedicated to Hytale's Creative Mode.

summary: The Hytale Team talks swamps and character models.
mainText:
The Hytale Team kicked the day off strong by sharing a picture of a swamp, featuring a snake partially submerged in mud - clarifying it isn't a bug. Simon also teased a 'lot more' weapon types, none of which are configured. The Sloth also teased a creative mode gameplay video coming later in the week.

Slikey also confirmed that pretty much any model can be used as a player model in Singleplayer (even a talking peanut), but noted that it wouldn't carry into multiplayer, where server owners have ultimate control. When asked about using heightmaps for continents, Slikey said it would likely require modifications to generation algorithms, as Hytale doesn't directly use heightmaps.

summary: The Hytale Team talks features, modding, and Support-A-Creator Program.
mainText:
Taking to Twitter, Simon confirmed that a 'quick version' of backpacks do exist in Hytale, and announced a creative mode blogpost would be coming in the same week - teasing rulers and laser pointers. Simon also shared a map screenshot of an Outlander village, showcasing multiple death waypoints, a manually set waypoint, and a home icon. When a user complimented the generation of icebergs in the screenshot, Simon stated that the generation was old world gen, teasing the new world gen. Wrapping up the day's gameplay tweets, Simon confirmed the team would be showcasing content for the casual/farming community in the near future.

Discussing modding potential, Simon confirmed that dig speed, tool powers, loot distribution, and more can be edited while the game is running, along with WorldGen!

Simon also made one major announcement - an official Support-A-Creator revenue share program for Hytale, with followers able to use Creator Codes. In a followup, Simon confirmed smaller community members will get a chance in the program.

summary: Simon requests community ideas for Technoblade tribute in Hytale.
mainText: On November 22nd, 2025, Simon announced he had received Technoblade's father's blessing to add something to Hytale that represents Technoblade's memory. In his post, Simon requested the community share their ideas for a meaningful tribute.

summary: The Hytale Team talks accessibility, tech, and gameplay.
mainText:
Responding to a question about accessibility options for the visually impaired, Simon shouted out Mewen as a strong advocate for accessibility, saying he'll be working on accessibility post-launch. Mewen confirmed the team is already planning for controller support (including Adaptive Controller from Microsoft), and considering features like multi-press, changing controller schema based on context, and also discussed features/designs for people who are hard of hearing, such as a visual audio cue wheel and a ping wheel. Mewen also mentioned assessing text resizing options.

Discussing the game's tech, Slikey revealed that Hytale plans to have a compatibility layer in the future, to give players the change to update their mods and servers. Slikey later confirmed that Hytale does currently have an error similar to Minecraft's bug that leads to the 'farlands' phenomenon. Slikey also discussed merging all of the game's branches into a single branch in a Singularity Event. Simon also revealed that Hytale currently has no plans for custom shaders, but the team will explore options later on.

Moving to gameplay discussions, Simon revealed that the new engine's lighting system can be replicated in the legacy engine, and the plan is to do so after optimizations are finished. Simon also revealed that Hytale's combat was designed with PVP in mind, but the current goal isn't to balance it for PVP or minigames. Simon also revealed that gliders have been added to Hytale, and that rat's can still be lured by dropped cheese.

Hytale officially shared a screenshot of a Zone 3 Ritual.

2: Mewen - Supporting different types of Controllers

summary: The Hytale Team talks release, pricing, and gameplay.
mainText:
On November 21st, The Hytale Team announced that Hytale's Early Access will launch with three editions - Standard Edition (USD$20), Supporter Edition (USD$35), and Cursebreaker Edition (USD$75) - with Supporter and Cursebreaker editions coming with exclusive cosmetics. Simon confirmed that Cursebreaker edition would not come with extra copies of the game, and thus the price was reduced as compensation. Simon also confirmed that the Early Access release date would be announced by end of next week.

Moving on to gameplay discussions, Simon confirmed that Hytale will not have grid crafting, and will instead have a more innovative and intuitive crafting system that allows players to upgrade work stations. When asked about building, Simon announced that work on block rotations and other cool features was finished, with connections and smart block placements being polished. Simon also mentioned that plans exist for automations and fun gadgets, but aren't being worked on at the moment. Simon also teased gliders and hookshots as future features for Hytale, also revealing the discovery of a Faun model in the game's files. Finally, Simon shared the first ever picture of Slothians in-game.

Later, Slikey explains that singleplayer mode creates a local server, allowing for 'server side' mods to work on singleplayer. Alleviating concerns, Slikey confirmed that despite this, singleplayer can be played without an internet connection. Finally, Slikey explained that it's likely too early for Hytale to be able to support a Create-like mod, though some parts should still be possible.

3: Simon - Early Access launch date announcement next week

14: Slikey - Technical Possibility for Create Mod

summary: The Hytale Team talk steps to release, usernames, instance system, and modding.
mainText:
Starting the day strong, Simon revealed that the Hytale Team is working on locking down a release date, with hardware tests, legal/security work, and stabilization required before they can decide on a release date. Simon also confirmed the base edition of Hytale would cost less than USD$30, and confirmed players can upgrade between each edition of the game after initial purchase. Additionally, Simon confirmed that usernames will be unique! Simon also revealed that the game will have an instance system, which supports whole worlds or dungeons where block breaking is disabled.

Throughout the day, Hytale shared an official look at the Zone 4 caves - complete with raptors - and later released a short video showcasing a simple mod that made raptors rideable!

Following up yesterday's blogpost tease, Slikey shared the Modding Strategy and Status Blogpost, and discussed many topics afterwards; confirming no client-side modding, no singleplayer mods being brough to multiplayer, a post-launch goal of solving dynamic asset streaming, server-side UIs, and acknowledging how that creates concerns regarding accessibility.

7: Hytale - BP - Modding Strategy and Status Blogpost

summary: The Hytale Team talk gameplay video, VFX video, etc.
mainText:
Starting the day off strong, Simon revealed that hardware testing would begin soon, which would allow system requirements to be determined. Discussing the gameplay video, Simon revealed that the video was already outdated when it was published, and that the in-game map that was shown is brand new! Discussing tools, Simon confirmed there are lots of tiers, though they only different in durability and speed at the moment - though signature abilities are a long-term goal. Additionally, Simon revealed there isn't a campaign at the moment, only four zones are in the game, oceans exist but are currently lackluster, and that the bosses that are currently in-game are broken.

Simon also revealed that social features will come after launch, and that the team is exploring characters being transferrable between worlds.

Hytale also shared a timelapse video showcasing the Hytale Asset Editor, and Polina revealed that VFX can be attached to entities.

Simon later revealed that worlds are infinite, though it is currently disabled, that the tech systems can support living world systems as long as its configured, and that Cursebreaker Edition of Hytale will come with at least one cape.

Finally, Simon announced a Modding Strategy and Status blogpost would be shared the next day.

14: Simon - Modding Strategy & Status Blogpost tomorrow

summary: The Hytale Team shares new screenshots, information about Hytale.
mainText:
To begin the day, Simon shared a poll on Twitter asking fans what weapons they wanted to see in action first. He also shared that the status of the magic combat in Hytale was a bit 'boring,' adding that the team was importing interesting things from a branch of the game's code - including totems! When asked about bosses, Simon said that there weren't any he was happy with - 'some are interesting, but got broken over the years.' Simon also mentioned having plans for a living world, and shared a picture of a Zone 3 enemy (temporarily) named the Shadow Knight.

Answering numerous questions, Hytale's Tech Lead - Slikey - confirmed that Hytale's height limit currently is at 320 blocks, a decision made in 2016, and says the issue will eventually get revisited later. Slikey later confirmed a World Generation blogpost is planned, and will contain details about both world generation versions (which will both be released).

Hytale's YouTube channel also officially shared sixteen minutes of gameplay in a video entitled Breaking the Curse.

8: Slikey - Both Gens to be released

9: Hytale - YT - Breaking the Curse gameplay video

summary: Developers share initial information/thoughts about Hytale, updates status of Arcanite Games.
mainText: In the first post-saved tweet, Simon thanks Noxy for his work and for supporting the deal that brought the project home. When asked about releasing sample assets of avatars so modders can get a head start, Simon says he'll look into it. Taking to twitter, Hytale Tech Director Slikey put out a request for player questions about Hytale's tech, for answering in a future blogpost. Co-Founder/Executive Director Lyall provided an update on Arcanite Games, saying development was paused to enable the team to dedicate their entire time and focus on Hytale.

3: Slikey requests questions about Hytale tech for future use.

summary: Reddoons interviews Simon!
mainText: On November 17th, 2025, Reddoons published an Exclusive Interview with Simon. In the interview, Simon stated that Exploration Mode was a temporary replacement for Adventure Mode, as the vision for the mode is far from what they can offer at the moment. Exploration Mode will server as the foundation for the game, eventually having a living world and other features that build and become Adventure Mode, such as dungeons, epic boss fights, and more. Exploration Mode will let players fight, loot, farm, explore, build, and play with friends - serving as more of a prologue to what Hytale will be. In the short to medium term, Simon wants to focus on fast wins, not spending months on a single update and instead bombarding players with constant updates before eventually moving to bigger updates when the game is in a solid state. Simon teases introducing features that are typical in RPGs or even ARPGs, and says the portals system in Hytale's End Game might be simple at launch, but is a feature that (in the long term vision) allows them to truly expand their creativity. Simon says Hytale is made different by its movements, combat, vibe, and controls, with the world gen v2 and ability to mod the game being very exciting to him. Crucially, Simon says he wants Hytale to not be a survival game, but an adventure game that is easy to learn and hard to master.

summary: AntVenom interviews Simon!
mainText: On November 17th, 2025, AntVenom published an Exclusive Interview with Simon. In the interview, Simon stated he believes his decision to sell Hytale was still the right decision, as it secured funding for the team, and put him in position to be able to purchase Hytale and attempt to save it. While the goal is to reach the vision of Hytale presented in the trailer, things will change due to the changes in circumstances/genre over the years. Simon repeatedly states that the community should keep expectations low, realize the game will launch with many bugs and missing features, but maintain confidence that the game will eventually be great. The trailer was 'ambitious, but achievable.' Simon says he wants players to feel at home - safe, comfortable, and excited - when they play Hytale for the first time. When asked about a 'credits roll' moment, Simon says he envisions credits never rolling, with the story continuing to be updated for years - no defined end point in development. When asked about a roadmap, Simon says the first goal is launch - then create a decent gameplay loop. Success for Hytale means releasing as soon as possible, and updating one feature at a time for a long time. Simon finishes the interview by thanking the believers.

1: AntVenom - HYTALE IS SAVED (Exclusive Interview w/ Hypixel)
